overview_of_class: This course introduces photographic equipment, materials and processes. Extensive darkroom instruction will emphasize high-quality black-and-white printing and creative darkroom control. Classroom discussion and lectures will explore the aesthetics of camera vision. No previous studio experience necessary. Bring camera (35-mm operable with automatic settings off) and one roll of Tri-X black-and-white 36-exposure film to first class. Enrollment is limited to 12. May not be audited or taken P/N.
name: Introduction to Photography
title: SCS ART 150-CN-65 Introduction to Photography

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces photographic equipment, materials and processes. Extensive darkroom instruction will emphasize high-quality black-and-white printing and creative darkroom control. Classroom discussion and lectures will explore the aesthetics of camera vision. No previous studio experience necessary. Bring camera (35-mm operable with automatic settings off) and one roll of Tri-X black-and-white 36-exposure film to first class. Enrollment is limited to 12. May not be audited or taken P/N.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class sessions are devoted to lecture/demonstrations and group critiques that address both technique and content. Students work during class sessions as well as independently and students should be prepared to work in the photo lab outside of scheduled class meeting times.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation of student performance is based on attendance, participation, ability to absorb and implement information through assignments, and a final project.

subject: ART
